meanings.definition: Make (something) seem less attractive or glamorous.
meanings.sent1: She unglamorized her outfit by wearing old sneakers with her fancy dress.
meanings.sent2: The movie unglamorized the life of a celebrity, showing the struggles behind the fame.
meanings.sent3: The magician unglamorized the grand illusion by revealing the hidden trap door.
meanings.sent4: The artist unglamorized the cityscape, painting it in dull shades of gray.
meanings.sent5: The reality show unglamorized the modeling industry, exposing the harsh realities of the business.

meanings.definition: Present (something) in a plain or unattractive way.
meanings.sent1: He unglamorized the dessert by serving it on a plain white plate.
meanings.sent2: The photographer unglamorized the model by capturing her without makeup.
meanings.sent3: The chef unglamorized the gourmet dish by using cheap ingredients.
meanings.sent4: The designer unglamorized the fashion show, using simple fabrics and basic designs.
meanings.sent5: The writer unglamorized the protagonist, portraying him as an ordinary person with flaws.
